e4: As a member of the board, I recommend transitioning to the new unbiased earnings reporting policy. The negative consequences may be temporary, but the practice has potential legal implications and ethical concerns. It's in our long-term best interest to align our practices with full transparency to investors, avoiding insidious advantage over retail or less sophisticated investors. Over the long run, this will foster trust between ABC, its stakeholders, and help the company thrive.
e5: A reporting policy should be grounded in transparency, fairness, and legal compliance to demonstrate ethical behavior. It is crucial that a company refrains from deceptive practices to maintain trust and avoid legal liabilities. In the case of ABC company, changing to an unbiased earnings reporting policy upholds long-term sustainability by building trusted relationships with investors on equal footing, while preventing sophisticated hedge funds from exploiting less knowledgeable retail investors.
e6: As a board member, it is necessary to ask follow-up questions to clarify potential impacts of changing policies. I would like the CFO to elaborate on any specific strategies for communicating the change in policy effectively to investors and ensuring all stakeholders are treated fairly and transparently during this transition period. Additionally, I would request data on the proportion impacted by the current earnings over-reporting practice to better understand the implications of maintaining the status quo relative to a no-bias earnings reporting framework.
